EXPLANATION.remote_environment: list of names of remote environments
EXPLANATION.supervisor_account: variable used on compute canada clusters to create the batches
EXPLANATION.user: username to access the remote computer. Password will be asked by nimb and stored in sqlite
EXPLANATION.users_list: if the number of users on the remote computer are more than 1, can be: ['user1','user2']
EXPLANATION.NIMB_HOME: where the local/remote nimb folder is downloaded
EXPLANATION.nimb_scratch_dir: Default is NIMB_RHOME/tmp path to a temporary folder where all temporary files will be saved. This folder needs to be put in a place that allows quick reading and writing and to delete the files; This folder can get very big. On compute canada it should be put on scratch
EXPLANATION.SOURCE_SUBJECTS_DIR: folder that has the raw MRIs of the subjects in archived or non-archived format
EXPLANATION.SOURCE_BIDS_DIR: path to a folder that, if NOT blank, pipeline will convert SOURCE_SUBJECTS_DIR to BIDS format
EXPLANATION.PROCESSED_FS_DIR: path to local or remote folder that has the data processed with FreeSurfer
EXPLANATION.PROCESSED_NIMB: path to folder where the processed subjects will be stored temporarily
EXPLANATION.SUBMIT: 1 for submit, 0 for not submit; defines if the scheduler batches are submitted to the scheduler. Is used to verify the batches
EXPLANATION.processing_env: slurm or tmux or moab is the environment used for processing data
EXPLANATION.max_nr_running_batches: the number of batches that can be sent to the scheduler at the same time
EXPLANATION.text4_scheduler: the text used for the scheduler
EXPLANATION.batch_output_cmd: command used in the batch to define the path of the output file
EXPLANATION.submit_cmd: command used to submit the batch to the scheduler
EXPLANATION.batch_walltime: walltime maximal for the pipeline to reinitate itself; 3 hours is the duration that is used by the scheduler to quickly deploy the script
EXPLANATION.python3_load_cmd: command if python is used as module, can be: module load python/3.8.2
EXPLANATION.python3_run_cmd: command used on the local or remote computer that is used to initiate python 3
EXPLANATION.FreeSurfer_install: 1 = install, 0 = no installation; define if the local/remote compute will be used to perform FreeSurfer analysis
EXPLANATION.freesurfer_version: default is 7 (for 7.1.0) but pipeline should also work with versions 6 and 5
EXPLANATION.FREESURFER_HOME: path to the freesurfer folder. Default is $NIMB_HOME/freesurfer. If OS is Windows, pipeline will ask the credentials for a remote Linux/Mac
EXPLANATION.FS_SUBJECTS_DIR: Default is $FREESURFER_HOME/subjects, path to the folder where the subjects are being processed by FreeSurfer
EXPLANATION.export_FreeSurfer_cmd: in some cases this command has to be adjusted
EXPLANATION.source_FreeSurfer_cmd: command might be different if FreeSurfer is used as module
EXPLANATION.process_order: list of processing steps in FreeSurfer.: registration,autorecon1,autorecon2,autorecon3,qcache,brstem,hip,tha; For FreeSurfer version lower thatn 7, tha must be removed; Instead of autorecon1, autorecon2 and autorecon3, the commmand recon-all can be used, but it will take more time for processing and this can be limited by the scheduler
EXPLANATION.archive_processed: if 1 the processed subjects must be archived with zip; if 0 subjects are NOT archived
EXPLANATION.masks: list of masks names of subcortical regions for which the user wants FreeSurfer to create masks
EXPLANATION.flair_t2_add: 1 or 0: defines if Flair or T2 images should be used (1) or not (0) for the FreeSurfer processing
EXPLANATION.DO_LONG: 1 (True) or 0 (False): defines if longitudinal analysis needs to be made
EXPLANATION.base_name: the name of the base subject that will be created during the longitudinal analysis with FreeSurfer
EXPLANATION.long_name: abbreviation used to define the longitudinal time points for subjects; default is ses-
EXPLANATION.GLM_file_group: PATH to the file.csv or file.xlsx that has the subjects, groups and variables for statistical analyis
EXPLANATION.id_col: name of the column in the file.csv that includes the names of the subjects similar to the names in PROCESSED_FS_DIR
EXPLANATION.group_col: name of the column in the file.csv that includes the groups
EXPLANATION.variables_for_glm: list of variables from the columns in file.csv file for statistical analysis, FreeSurfer GLM and correlations
EXPLANATION.GLM_dir: path to the folder were the glm analysis will be made
EXPLANATION.GLM_measurements: cortical parameters that will be used for FreeSurfer GLM analysis: thickness,area,volume,curv
EXPLANATION.GLM_thresholds: threshold levels for smoothing in mm, used for FreeSurfer GLM analysis: 5,10,15,20,25
EXPLANATION.GLM_MCz_cache: level of FreeSurfer GLM MCZ simulation threshold 13 equals to p:0.05
